result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly L Heidenreich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Any Jail Credit left over after calculations in Case #13CF1471 are to be applied to this Imposed and Stayed Sentence.
Consecutive to: Waukesha County Cases:  #13CF948 and #13CF1470.

Conditions of Extended Supervision are the same as Conditions of Probation.
Consecutive to: Waukesha County Cases:  #13CF948 and #13CF1470.

Court will consider early termination after 3 years if all aspects of Probation in this case have been completed.
AS OF 7/07/2014: Probation changed to 3 YEARS.
Concurrent with: Waukesha County Cases:  #13CF948 and #13CF1470.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
WCS Day Report Center Court Completion Notice.
DRC Informational Court Report. Reviewed by the Court.
DRC Informational Court Report. Reviewed by the Court.
Review/Modification Requested/Recommended from Department of Corrections.

Defendant Kelly L Heidenreich in court, in custody, with attorney Nick Martinez.    Barbara Michaels and District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant's mother spoke. 
  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

6 YEARS IMPRISONMENT - consecutive to 13CF948 and 13CF1470. Any jail credit left over after calculations in 13CF1471 are to be applied to this imposed and stayed sentence.
  -  3 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  4 YEAR(S); concurrent with 13CF948 and 13CF1470.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with any co-actor.
*Attend at least 3 self help meetings per week. 
*Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COURT COSTS: Waived.

DNA SURCHARGE:  Waived.

CONDITION TIME:  180 DAYS - NON WORKING HOURS w/Standard Release Conditions; LAST 90 DAYS IS STAYED for DAY REPORT CENTER of 120 DAYS, Consecutive to condition time.  Good time not allowed on DRC.  If defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 90 days of condition time stayed will be permanently stayed.  Condition time to commence forthwith. 

**Court will consider early termination after 3 years if all aspects of probation in this case have been completed. 

**Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on June 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.  Court orders bail revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
